item.title: Pinned: Those who do not learn history are doomed to repeat it. Those who do learn history are doomed to watch it repeated by those who didn‚Äôt.
item.dc:creator: @meyerweb

description.p: Those who do not learn history are doomed to repeat it. Those who do learn history are doomed to watch it repeated by those who didn‚Äôt.

item.title:
RT by @meyerweb: EPISODE ALERT! üö®
In the last interview episode of 2021, I talked to Eric Meyer @meyerweb about the web. How it was, what it is now, as well as the 2022 schedule (fingers crossed) for @aneventapart and much, much more!

item.title:
I still smile remembering how one of our kids, when they were a toddler, used to sing:
‚ÄúSpider-Man, Spider-Man Does whatever a spider can Spins a web any size Catches bees just like flies Look out, here comes Spider-Man‚Äù
‚Ä¶over and over.
(I absolutely did not correct them.)
item.dc:creator: @meyerweb

description.p:
I still smile remembering how one of our kids, when they were a toddler, used to sing:
‚ÄúSpider-Man, Spider-Man Does whatever a spider can Spins a web any size Catches bees just like flies Look out, here comes Spider-Man‚Äù
‚Ä¶over and over.
(I absolutely did not correct them.)

item.title: RT by @meyerweb: This. Not new and I still find myself looking up what turn out to be well known computer science terms because I didn‚Äôt have a formal education in the subject. I often know the concept but not the right word.
item.dc:creator: @rachelandrew

item.title: CSS (as a full specification) is now a quarter-century old. One generation. And still it continues to mature and deepen, like true love or a fine wine. Thank you to everyone who‚Äôs been a part of its story over all those years.
item.dc:creator: @meyerweb

description.p:

item.title:
RT by @meyerweb: Happy 25th birthday CSS1!
On December 17, 1996, W3C issued official recommendations for language specification, Cascading Style Sheets, level 1 (CSS1).
https://www.webdesignmuseum.org/web-design-history/css-1-1996
#CSS1 #InternetHistory
item.dc:creator: @WebDesignMuseum

item.title: A bunch of scientists quantum-entangled a qubit with a superfrozen tardigrade and I just want to know what that funding proposal looked like https://arxiv.org/abs/2112.07978
item.dc:creator: @meyerweb

description.p: A bunch of scientists quantum-entangled a qubit with a superfrozen tardigrade and I just want to know what that funding proposal looked like arxiv.org/abs/2112.07978

item.title: One of the things I love about working for @igalia is their dedication to democratizing the advancement of the web as much as they can. I wrote about our Open Prioritization effort (and it two-so-far projects, ':focus-visible' and MathML Core) for the @opencollect blog.
item.dc:creator: @meyerweb

description.p:
One of the things I love about working for @igalia is their dedication to democratizing the advancement of the web as much as they can. I wrote about our Open Prioritization effort (and it two-so-far projects, ':focus-visible' and MathML Core) for the @opencollect blog.
nitter.net/igalia/status/1471846428519673856#m

item.title:
Today I submitted my first pull request against the HTML specification.
The HTML.
Specification.
No idea how long and how much adjustment it will take to get to acceptance, so not linking it yet. But still!
I just, I‚Ä¶¬†need a few minutes.
item.dc:creator: @meyerweb

description.p:

Specification.

item.title: RT by @meyerweb: This is a great story by @chrisderose about a terrible case, and a sobering look at how the system doesn‚Äôt care if you really did it, only if they can clear very low hurdles to convince a judge maybe you did it
item.dc:creator: @Popehat

item.title: RT by @meyerweb: Obituary: bell hooks, a Hopkinsville native who went on to an international career as an author, critic, feminist and public intellectual, died on Dec. 15 at her home in Berea. She was 69. @lbblackford https://www.kentucky.com/news/state/kentucky/article256616171.html
item.dc:creator: @heraldleader

item.title: RT by @meyerweb: /3 Proponents of anti-CRT laws claim they don't oppose teaching historical fact, but they are, and I apologize for using legal mumbo-jumbo, obviously full of shit. This is calculated, and likely, to make it dangerous and expensive to teach facts.
item.dc:creator: @Popehat

description.p: /3 Proponents of anti-CRT laws claim they don't oppose teaching historical fact, but they are, and I apologize for using legal mumbo-jumbo, obviously full of shit. This is calculated, and likely, to make it dangerous and expensive to teach facts.
